Portal - From A Gamer Who Hates Puzzle Games

As the title of this review suggests I hate puzzle games. CandyCrush, WordPress they've never appealed to me as I feel like enjoying myself in a game should be mindlessly wandering or making mayhem without thinking... but Portal makes you think. And I love it!

Portal hasn't got much of a story nor any characters apart from yourself and a hilarious A.I. that speaks to you throughout the different levels otherwise referred to as chambers. While the lack of any story may turn some players away I beg you to look past that as this game has more on the table to make up for this trade off. The whole idea of the game is you are a nameless character testing a new device for Aperture Science Laboratories, what device? A portal gun! This nifty little thing allows you to place a blue portal and an orange portal and traverse between the two with all kinds of crazy physics and wacky puzzle solutions which never failed to keep me entertained through the game. Your character never speaks and the campus you are testing this device on can seem lonely and empty at times adding an eerie and creepy tone to the game with hidden areas of people claiming strange things about the laboratory. All while doing this your friend/A.I. will be mocking, praising and nagging you about cake the whole time which adds a lot of humour to the game and I really love this. 

In terms of it's visual style Portal has a Mirrors Edge vibe to it with nothing but white and a few extra colours here ans there. There isn't anything pretty to look at or any fancy effects just a plain white room where your being tested, and while this may seem as though it's a boring-looking game it really helps immerse yourself inside it and strengthen that creepy tone. Not to mention this also means the game will run great on older hardware so don't worry if your grandmas vista machine cant handle it because I bet it can! 

Now before I conclude I'd like to talk about the puzzle and the games length. Firstly, the puzzles in this game are fantastic! Some levels have multiple ways of completion while others have only one way. Some levels you instantly figure out what to do while others you will sit there scratching your head for a long while and that's what makes the game so brilliant. The way it makes you think about the physics of the portals and forces you to get creative leads to some extremely memorable levels and there is a massive sense of achievement when you finish a level and get excited to start the next. Sadly though this comes with one slight drawback. The game is very short. It takes about 3.5 hours to finish this game which leaves you craving more and while the game does have a good bit of replayability the only real extra time you'll spend playing this game is doing the challenge runs which are just the same levels with a twist (like you can only take 3 steps or use 5 portals).

Despite it's length Portal is easily the best puzzle game I've ever played and it has made me more open to the puzzle genre I may even consider buying a puzzler in the future. I feel like this is a must play game for anyone puzzle fan or not. it can run on just about anything, good to kill the time, very rewarding to finish. 

9.2/10 ~ Neppy Review.

Joyita
"Hello?"

Portal is a puzzle game made by Valve that came out in 2007. You play as Chell, a girl who is trapped inside the Aperture Science facility, with the company of GLaDOS, an AI. 

The game is fun, and does a great job at showing the player the mechanics as the player advances the levels. 
It's also worth mentioning that it does not get repetitive, thanks to new additions and the increase in difficulty. 

On the other hand, it isn't very replayable (despite some Bonus Maps and the Commentary Mode) and it's very short. I managed to beat it in three hours, but I wouldn't complain for the price I paid: during the Steam Sales you can find this game for €1 ($1,21 at the time of writing). 

I'd give this game a 8/10, and would recommend the purchase to every Steam User out there (especially if you can get the Bundle which includes the second chapter), even those who generally don't like puzzles.

*Inhales*

[h1]Gameplay and Story Connection at its Finest[/h1]

Portal is a game that proves you don't need 4k graphics to tell an amazing, complex story that will make the players want more. By the way, don't worry, no spoilers are ahead!

I'll talk about mechanics and pacing of the puzzles, which is a high point nobody talks about. The idea of making your own pathways to get to new platforms is very clever, and the physics of the game with the portals makes the puzzles even more fun. As they say, speedy thing goes in, speedy thing comes out. The way the gameplay interacts with the story is also a highlight. The pacing of the gameplay with the story is also something that makes those games fun to play. Overall, definitely play this game. Period. Unless you don't like great puzzles and a rich story, you can decide.
great game for new gamers, or non-gamers, or veteran gamers. very amazing storytelling, really is an amazing game. also really fun to speedrun.
Bardzo fajne, zagrałem jako preludium do Portal 2 i nie zawiodłem sie

Cosa dire su Portal che non sia già stato detto tipo... tremila volte?

Vi basta sapere che venne alla luce in un simpatico bundle che racchiudeva il sequel di Half-Life 2 (uno dei giochi più acclamati, innovativi e ambiziosi di sempre) e Team Fortress 2 (Probabilmente lo sparatutto multiplayer più iconico e simpatico di sempre, atteso da quasi 10 anni dopo mille promesse inadempiute).... E nonostante ciò, Portal non sfigurava affatto davanti a quei due bestioni ed è tuttora considerato uno dei titoli migliori del 2007, uno dei puzzle game più belli mai fatti e uno dei franchise di punta del colosso di Gaben.

Facile facile da riassumere. Vestirete i panni di Chell, una cavia umana che si risveglia in uno stanzino abbandonato dei laboratori Aperture Science. Il vostro compito è quello di superare una serie di trappole mortali con la vostra "Portal Gun" (Pistola spara portali, per chi non sopporta anglicismi) e sconfiggere GLaDOS, l'intelligenza artificiale assassina e sadica che infesta le rovine dei laboratori torturando fisicamente (e, soprattutto, psicologicamente) la nostra eroina silenziosa.

Semplice ma efficace, un concetto che può riassumere la storia ma anche il gameplay. L'idea di sparare dei portali per superare un rompicapo potrebbe non sembrare particolarmente avvincente, ma questo concept da molti considerabile banalotto e noioso è sostenuto da un design dei livelli eccezionale, colpi di scena interessanti, atmosfera semi-horror azzeccatissima e i tanti, TANTI commenti sarcastici ed esilaranti di GLaDOS. Da soli valgono il prezzo del gioco.

E' un gioco corto, ma sa intrattenerti dall'inizio alla fine senza mai annoiare e non è affatto un'impresa di poco conto considerata la apparente ripetitività del gameplay e il fatto che ci siano solo due personaggi.

Molto divertente, humor impeccabile, gameplay innovativo... Non avete motivo per giocarci, non tirate fuori la scusa del "mio PC che fa schifo" perché questo gioco fa miracoli anche sul PC puzzolente, scassato vietnamita di vostro zio.

Consigliatissimo.

[i] Valve'dan yine harika bir oyun daha... [/i]

Portal 1, ikinci oyunu kadar kapsamlı ve uzun bir oyun değil 2-3 saatlik bir oyun, co-op modu da yok (2. oyunda var). Bulmacaların da öyle aman aman bir zorluğu yok normal düzeyde. Sadece son bulmaca yerinde ve laboratuvardan kaçarken birazcık zorlanabilirsiniz.

En kısa şekilde özetlersek: Chell isimli ana karakterimiz portal silahını kullanarak Aperture Science laboratuvarından kaçmaya çalışıyor.

Oyunda sadece iki karakterimiz  var 1.Chell: Geçmişi belirsiz denek olarak alınmış bir kadın, 2. bizi bulmacalara koyan, denek olarak kullanan laboratuvarın ana kaynağı olan GLaDOS. -aynı zamanda Caroline'in beynini taşıyor-

[b] Bu oyunu kimler mi almalı ? [/b] Orta düzeyde bulmaca oyunlarını seviyorsanız, çok da uğraştırmasın beni aman, diyorsanız tam size göre keyif alırsınız.

[h1]评分：10/10，这就是一款让玩家感到非常新鲜的第一人称解谜的作品，有着完整的故事体验和游戏流程，无论从创意和玩法上，都有着很大的开创性。[/h1]

《传送门》的第一部作品，开发者利用FPS引擎做出了超乎常人想象的益智游戏。
故事并没有太多的铺垫，也没有讲述主角是谁，而是以第一人称的视角，渐渐地让玩家了解了整个游戏的目的，而最让人感兴趣的是通过场景的布置和策划，玩家可以从那些写满涂鸦的管道，散乱的办公柜中感受到自己身边发生了什么。
游戏主要的操作很简单，而最有意思的是“传送枪”这个核心设备，玩家可以使用这个设备实现一些意想不到的方式，穿越那些看似根本无法穿越的地带，这也是当时为数不多通过物理来进行游戏的之一。
当然，这一部作品只是个开始，若是论惊艳程度，《传送门2》更会让玩家体验到更刺激《传送门》系列的故事和新鲜玩意儿，以及更多的有趣关卡。

In my opinion, Portal (and its successor, Portal 2) is the best game Valve has made. It has a lot of creative ideas and the best video game character (in my opinion). Namely GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System). The game includes several very funny phrases in each test chamber. The sequel, Portal 2, is (in my opinion) a bit better as it has longer, more content, a deeper story and even funnier sentences. All in all, Portal is a must and a classic. It's also terribly cheap, which I can't understand. The game could easily have cost 99.99 euros XD. Portal is simply an all-time classic and shines even more with the second part. And never forget "EVERYTHING FOR SCIENCE".

Portal-это классика, это знать надо.
 Без лишних слов приступим к обзору:
1. Сюжет: неплох.  Приятный но немного коротковат (это относится ко всей игре).
2. Идея: гениальна. И порталы, и эксперименты на людях, и злобный искусственный интеллект.
3.  Геймплей: прекрасен. Мне не встретилось не одного бага, и все механики работали исправно.
4. Персонажи: есть и ладно. У нас имеется главная героиня (Чел) и злая робот (ГЛэДОС).
 Ну куда же без минусов:
-Озвучка и перевод: просто ужасны. Голос неприятный, нет шуток и колкостей которые были в оригинале, в некоторых местах голоса ломаются и пропадают (я знаю что эту тему обсосал каждый).
 Portal была одной из самых первых игры которую я купил и скажу честно она стоит своих денег. Сама по себе Portal приятный продукт на несколько вечеров не напряжного геймплея.
 Игра очень даже хороша. Мне кажется она понравится всем, в особенности любителям головоломок.
